--- title: "On the topic of Optimization" date: "2023-06-09" categories: [Workflow] #sidebar: false #number-sections: true --- I use daily shortcuts to optimize my workflow. Below the apps I use in a daily basis: ### Microsoft Edge > Prefer this over Safari because of add-ons I used it to install apps like YouTube or Google Translator so that when I hit a [shortcut command](#hammerspoon), it opens that app. Here it's an example. ### Hammerspoon > [App Link](https://www.hammerspoon.org/). Creates global shortcuts Uses `Lua` programming language to assign keybindings to certain actions. Here a sneak peek of what can you do. ```lua --- Open App function open(name) return function() hs.application.launchOrFocus(name) if name == 'Finder' then hs.appfinder.appFromName(name):activate() end end end ``` The above function can be called to open an `app: Google Maps` by an i.e. the shortcut: `âŒ˜ + M` ```lua --- Binding Keys hs.hotkey.bind({ "cmd" }, "M", open("Google Maps")) ``` For complete implementation visit, this [repo](https://github.com/danilotpnta/hammerspoon-config). For Windows alternative version: [//]: # (
Code) ```{c} #MaxHotkeysPerInterval 200 !WheelUp::Volume_Up !WheelDown::Volume_Down !MButton::Volume_Mute <#!e:: Run, %WINDIR%\explorer.exe return !q::Send !{F4} return <#!x:: Run, msedge.exe return !y:: Run, C:\Users\Macbook Pro 13\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\YouTube.lnk return !t:: Run, C:\Users\Macbook Pro 13\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Google Translate.lnk return ``` [//]: # (
